title: Clone a $1.275B App in 30 Minutes with Claude Code
description: Build a custom Frame.io alternative using Claude Code - save thousands yearly by creating exactly what your team needs.

cards.title: Build a $1.275B App Clone in 30 Minutes
cards.body: You'll learn how to recreate Frame.io's core features using Claude Code, saving your team thousands yearly. We'll build video commenting, file attachments, project sharing, and deploy it live. No coding experience required - just smart prompting and iteration.

cards.title: The 80/20 SaaS Replacement Strategy
cards.body: Most teams pay full price for SaaS tools but only use 20% of features. The smart approach: identify exactly what you use daily, then build only those features.

analogy.text: Like ordering a whole pizza when you only eat pepperoni slices. Instead, make exactly the slices you want.

diagram.caption: Build only what you actually use

cards.safe: This approach works for internal tools where you control the requirements.

source.author: Riley Brown
source.description: The cost breakdown of Frame.io vs custom solution

cards.title: Audit Your Current Tool Usage
cards.body: Before building anything, list every feature you actually use daily in your current SaaS tool. Ignore everything else - this becomes your build specification.
bullets: Open your current tool (Frame.io, Notion, Airtable, etc.)
Screenshot or write down only the features you use weekly
Note specific workflows that matter to your team
Skip advanced features you've never touched
cards.warn: Don't get feature-creep excited. Stick to genuine daily needs only.

cards.title: Why Claude Code vs Regular Claude
cards.body: Claude Code isn't just the API - it's the full coding agent that can run terminal commands, manage files, and iterate on code. Think of it as having a senior developer who never gets tired.

diagram.caption: Claude Code handles the full development workflow

bullets: Runs actual terminal commands in a sandbox
Can install packages and manage dependencies
Iterates and fixes issues without starting over
Handles database setup and deployment
cards.cta: Ready to use the full agent

read.body:
The key difference is execution environment. Regular Claude can write code but can't run it. Claude Code operates in a full development sandbox where it can:

Execute commands: Install npm packages, run build scripts, start servers
Manage files: Create, edit, and organize project structure
Debug issues: See actual error messages and fix them
Test functionality: Run the app and verify features work

This makes Claude Code perfect for complete application development, not just code generation.

callouts.text: Tools like Vibe Code, Replit, and Lovable all provide different interfaces to similar coding agents.

cards.title: Quick Strategy Check
cards.question: What should you include when prompting Claude Code to build a SaaS alternative?

options.text: Every feature the original tool has to be comprehensive
Only the features you actually use daily, plus context research
A detailed technical architecture and database schema
All the advanced features to future-proof the build

cards.correctFeedback: Exactly! Focus on real usage patterns and let Claude research the original tool for context. Less is more for internal tools.
cards.wrongFeedback: Remember the 80/20 rule - most SaaS complexity comes from features you'll never use. Build exactly what you need, nothing more.

cards.title: Set Up Your Development Environment
cards.body: Choose your Claude Code platform and create your first project. We'll use a tool that runs Claude Code in the browser for instant deployment.
bullets: Go to Vibe Code, Replit, or similar Claude Code platform
Create a new web app project
Verify you can access the Claude Code interface
Test with a simple prompt like 'make a hello world app'
cards.warn: Different platforms have different Claude Code implementations. Pick one that feels intuitive to you.

cards.title: Craft Your Build Prompt
cards.body: Write a comprehensive prompt that includes your feature list, context research instruction, and security basics. This prompt quality determines your build success.
cards.code:
Build an app like Frame.io with these features:
1. Upload video and save as project
2. Add timestamped comments while watching
3. Attach files to comments
4. Password protect with 'banana'
5. Generate shareable project links

Search internet for context on Frame.io layout and UX.
cards.codeCaption: Notice the specific features, security method, and research instruction
bullets: Start with 'Search internet for context on [tool name]'
List only your essential features (3-6 max for first build)
Add simple password protection for internal tools
Specify sharing/collaboration requirements
cards.warn: Don't write a novel. Claude Code works better with clear, structured feature lists.

source.author: Riley Brown
source.description: Breaking down the Frame.io clone prompt structure

cards.title: Ready to Build Like a Pro!
cards.body: You've identified your target features, understand Claude Code's capabilities, and crafted a solid build prompt. Now comes the exciting part - watching Claude Code transform your idea into a working application in minutes.

cards.title: Execute Your First Build
cards.body: Paste your prompt into Claude Code and let it work. You'll see it create a task list, set up the database, build the interface, and deploy your app.
cards.code: [Paste your crafted prompt here and hit enter]
bullets: Paste your complete prompt into the Claude Code interface
Watch it break down tasks (usually 6-10 steps)
Let it complete the full build (takes 5-15 minutes)
Don't interrupt - Claude Code works best uninterrupted
cards.warn: The first build won't be perfect. That's expected - we'll iterate in the next steps.

troubleshoot.label: Build seems stuck
troubleshoot.fix: Refresh the page and try a simpler prompt first. Break complex features into separate builds.

troubleshoot.label: Too many errors
troubleshoot.fix: Let Claude Code finish, then describe what's wrong conversationally rather than technical debugging.

source.author: Riley Brown
source.description: Watching Claude Code execute the Frame.io build in real-time

cards.title: The Art of Conversational Iteration
cards.body: When your first build has issues (it will), don't rewrite everything. Talk to Claude Code like a teammate - describe the problem conversationally and let it fix incrementally.

analogy.text: Like telling a designer 'make the button bigger' instead of redrawing the whole mockup.

bullets: Good: 'I don't want URL input, I want file upload'
Good: 'The comments should appear on the right side'
Bad: Completely rewriting the original prompt
Bad: Technical debugging instructions
cards.safe: Claude Code remembers the entire conversation context, so iterations build on each other.
cards.cta: Ready to iterate like a pro

cards.title: Fix the Major Issues
cards.body: Test your app and identify the biggest problems. Address them one at a time with simple, conversational prompts to Claude Code.
bullets: Test every core feature you specified
Note what's missing or not working as expected
Write one conversational fix request at a time
Let Claude Code complete each fix before requesting the next
cards.code: I don't want a URL input, I want a file upload button where I can select a video from my computer. Please fix this.
cards.codeCaption: Clear, conversational, specific to one issue
cards.warn: Fix one major issue at a time. Don't pile on 5 requests in one prompt.

troubleshoot.label: Fix breaks other features
troubleshoot.error: Changing one thing breaks something else
troubleshoot.fix: Tell Claude Code exactly what broke: 'The upload works now but the password page disappeared. Please restore the password protection.'

source.author: Riley Brown
source.description: Iterating on the file upload functionality conversationally

cards.title: Iteration Best Practices
cards.question: When your app has multiple issues after the first build, what's the best approach?

options.text: List all problems in one big prompt to save time
Address one major issue at a time with conversational language
Start over with a more detailed technical prompt
Fix the code manually and then ask Claude to continue

cards.correctFeedback: Perfect! One issue at a time prevents Claude Code from getting confused and lets you verify each fix works before moving on.
cards.wrongFeedback: Claude Code works best with incremental, conversational fixes. Overwhelming it with multiple requests or starting over loses all the context it's built up.

cards.title: Add Your Custom Features
cards.body: Once core functionality works, add features that make your tool better than the original. This is where you get competitive advantage over expensive SaaS.
bullets: Think about workflow improvements your team would love
Add integrations the original tool doesn't have
Customize the UI for your team's specific needs
Consider mobile responsiveness if your team works on phones
cards.code: Add a feature where I can export all comments from a project as a PDF report with timestamps and file attachments included.
cards.codeCaption: Features like this would cost extra in most SaaS tools
cards.safe: Custom features are where internal tools really shine - build exactly what your workflow needs.

cards.title: Deploy and Share Your App
cards.body: Get your app live on the internet so your team can start using it immediately. Most Claude Code platforms handle deployment automatically.
bullets: Look for a 'Deploy' or 'Share' button in your platform
Copy the public URL for your team
Test the app from the public URL (not preview)
Update your password from 'banana' to something secure
cards.code:
Your app is live at: https://your-app-domain.com
Password: [your-secure-password]
cards.warn: Change the default password before sharing widely. Consider IP restrictions for sensitive tools.

troubleshoot.label: Deploy button missing
troubleshoot.fix: Ask Claude Code: 'How do I deploy this app so my team can access it?' Different platforms have different deployment flows.

troubleshoot.label: App not loading publicly
troubleshoot.error: Works in preview but not on public URL
troubleshoot.fix: Check if all files were included in deployment. Ask Claude Code to verify the build includes all necessary assets.

cards.title: Calculate Your Savings Impact
cards.body: Your custom tool just saved your team thousands per year. Here's how to think about the ROI and what tools to tackle next.

diagram.caption: Multiply this across multiple tools for massive savings

bullets: Time invested: 30-60 minutes to build and deploy
Annual savings: $200-500+ per user per tool
Team benefit: Exactly the features you need, no bloat
Control: Add features instantly when needs change
cards.safe: This approach works best for tools where you use <20% of features and have stable requirements.

cards.title: You Just Cloned a Billion-Dollar App!
cards.body: You've successfully built a custom Frame.io alternative with video commenting, file attachments, project sharing, and deployment. You can now identify underused SaaS features, prompt Claude Code effectively, iterate conversationally, and deploy internal tools that save thousands yearly.
